Hai's devlog

Spaceship operator in C++20 is awesome!

Apr 3, 2021

When you write a class in C++ with a plentiful amount of data, you soon realize you need some ways to compare objects of this type. The new spaceship <=> operator in C++20 help you do that while keeping your code clean.

As can be easily seen, it works like strcmp in C when comparing two strings. In C++98 through C++17 you would have six operators to overload: ==, !=, <, >, <= and >= which is a boring chore.
